test_name: Verify Navigation to 'Return to Shop' from Empty Cart
description: Ensure that users can navigate to the shop page from the empty cart page using the 'RETURN TO SHOP' button.
steps: Verify the visibility of the message indicating the cart is empty.
Click on the 'RETURN TO SHOP' button.
Verify that the user is redirected to the shop page at https://atid.store/store/.
Confirm that the shop page displays a list of products for browsing.
expected_results: The 'RETURN TO SHOP' button is visible on the cart page.
Clicking the button redirects the user to the shop page.
The shop page correctly displays a list of products.
edge_cases: The 'RETURN TO SHOP' button is not visible or clickable.
The redirection fails and the user remains on the cart page.
The shop page fails to load or displays an error.
The shop page loads partially or without product listings.
The user's browser blocks the redirection due to security settings.
data_requirements: Access to the cart page URL.
The 'RETURN TO SHOP' button must be enabled.
The shop page URL must be accessible.
Product data must be available for display on the shop page.
dependencies: Cart page with an empty state.
Functional redirection from the cart page.
Browser compatibility for the button click event.
api_interactions: Verify no API calls are required for the redirection.
Ensure no API failures on the shop page loading.
Monitor potential API calls for fetching product data on the shop page.
performance_metrics: Time taken for the redirection to complete.
Time taken to load the shop page.
Responsiveness of the 'RETURN TO SHOP' button.
accessibility_requirements: The 'RETURN TO SHOP' button must have appropriate ARIA labels.
The empty cart message must be screen-reader friendly.
Keyboard navigation to the 'RETURN TO SHOP' button must be functional.
Contrast ratio for the button text and background must meet WCAG standards.
Ensure no motion-based triggers are required for interaction.
